main event: A civilian observed a yellow-white crescent shaped light, believed to be a hot air balloon, on January 7, 1969 in Cleveland, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 15-20 minutes before it disappeared., The observer reported a zigzag motion of the object against the sky., The sighting included visual similarity to past observations of garment bag hot air balloons., The object was seen to the North and eventually moved towards the South., The weather was noted as having cumulus clouds with good visibility.
witness description: civilian in a vehicle traveling at approximately 35 MPH
